basic_information.scholarship_name: Don Betz Leadership in the Arts Scholarship

description: This scholarship was established in 2007 to honor then provost and former president of the University of Central Oklahoma, Dr. Don Betz. Dr. Betz is an ardent supporter of the arts and was a key advocate for the establishment of a fine arts and design college at Central. Recipients must demonstrate leadership, personal achievement, integrity and character. Eligibility Any CFAD major Cumulative GPA 3.0+ Junior, senior, or graduate student Enrolled full-time (12+ Hours Undergraduate, 9+ Hours Graduate) Requirements Two faculty recommendation letters One-page (double-spaced) essay on your philosophy of leadership in the arts Personal artist statement (250 words) Official transcript

qualifying_criteria.description: Hard requirements that must be met to qualify for the scholarship

criteria.description: SIS_College is Fine Arts and Design   or SIS_College_2 is Fine Arts and Design
criteria.raw_text: SIS_College is Fine Arts and Design   or SIS_College_2 is Fine Arts and Design

criteria.description: Complete Application: "UCO Foundation Qualifying Scholarship Application"
criteria.raw_text: Complete Application: "UCO Foundation Qualifying Scholarship Application"

general_criteria.description: Soft requirements that provide additional points/consideration
